item.title: Musings #3
item.description: June is the most exciting month for me. Every year Apple organises its World Wide Developer Conference (WWDC) in June. I am a big Apple fan, been watching these since 2014 and now its almost 11 years and the level of excitement hasn’t changed a bit.

item.title: Musings #2
item.description: Oh man, did I skip a beat or what? I had thought that I would be regular in writing these but I have been shit lately. Let’s forget what happened and give it a fresh start. From now on, biweekly musings are going out.

item.title: Musings #1
item.description: It’s been a while since I have acquired this domain and thought about consistent writing. But, I kept procrastinating. I always felt what exactly should I write, and as I am queering my career in tech, I have plenty to express and write about now.

item.title: Thoughts
item.description: Everything I want but don’t have, and everything I have but don’t want, is because I lack knowledge. “The cosmos is within us. We are made of star-stuff. We are a way for the universe to know itself.” ~ Carl Sagan

item.title: Create new Google Doc from the search bar
item.description: TIL, you can create new doc, sheet, slide, form, site or a calendar event from the search bar at the top of the Chrome. This is so convinient if you’re a Chrome user. Create a new Google Doc: doc.new Create a new Google Sheet: sheet.

item.title: DFS?
item.description: I have always struggled with Depth First Search, DFS. I now have started solving it using first principles and it has started to make sense. DFS can be solved using two methods: Recursive solution Iterative solution, using stacks To solve recursively we must keep few things in our mind:

item.title: How to find good research papers?
item.description: There is plethora of research happening all around us and in the recent times the incoming number of research papers have increased by quite a number. This raises a question on how to find a good paper and give it a read.

item.description: My favorite links to some of the good posts i have read around the internet. item.title: Papers
item.description: The papers I am reading and I recommend. The list contains papers extensively from the fields of Physics, Machine Learning / Deep Learning and Software Engineering.

item.title: The AI Summer
item.description: Meta LLaMA, Stanford Alpaca, PaLM, OpenAI GPT-4. This week has been crazy. The previous week started with the storming LLaMA release from the Meta which advanced to weight leaks on the torrent. Then Stanford released the Alpaca model fine tuned from the LLaMA 7B model on 52K instruction-following demonstrations.

item.title: Hello, World
item.description: Hello, World #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { cout << "Hello, World!" << endl; return 0; }

item.title: Today I Learned
item.description: Whatever I end up learning on my day to day exploration. If it seem interesting to me I will share it as a post here. 2025 The SQLite codebase is spread out into several files, but for building they combine all of the source code into a single .

item.title: Uses this
item.description: Hardware, services and tools I am using to get things done. Starting with my dream setup which I found on r/battlestations. I would like to have a similar setup in the coming years for me. Dream Setup My Current Setup looks something like this.

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description: This will be interesting to some people, who want to read some great books and don’t know where to start from. I will try to have these books in physical form and I’ll keep updating this list as I read more books.

item.title: About
item.description: ipa nezubn /nɛzʌb/ — no meaning, i made it up an engineer, and a polymath Hi, I am Ankit aka (nezubn) and I have been working in the field of Machine Learning and Engineering for almost ~5 years. I like reading, building things, where things could be anything between a mobile application, an ml system, a compiler, an operating system, writing kernels.

item.title: Now
item.description: What I am doing now? Work I am working as a Machine Learning Engineer in a startup, OnionDev Tech (Gramvaani). My work involves around writing Django Apps to training and deploying Machine Learning models. Previous project: To make a QnA System from unstructured data where a farmer can ask anything about his/her crops over an IVR system.

item.title: People
item.description: Internet people who write about a variety of topics. I have tried to make this list of people sorted based on their expertise in their respective fields.
